comments: Sai is a great professor who makes the class a lot of fun. Her class is open syllabus so the topics covered are decided as the course progresses. Show up and participate and an A is guaranteed.
Sai is my favorite teacher ever, but she could stand to be a bit more of a hardass on vocabulary

This is my 5th Semester with Professor Bhatawadekar; I\'ve also taken Hindi 101, 102, 201, 202, and Urdu 205. It\'s simple. Do your work and you will gain a mastery of Hindi Language whilst getting the easiest A of your life. Do the work, and Sai will give the grade. Classes are fun, not too much of work, and engaging. I highly recommend.

saijii really knows her stuff...she teaches in a way that empowers the student and her approach makes it easy to learn and practice hindi language without "spoon-feeding" her students........do your work and you\'ll learn alot with her :-)

great class; awesome, intelligent, highly articulate beauty of a professor. some students try to take advantage of her kind heart and resort to posting the hostile comments you see here when they find that she can\'t be made a fool of. highly recommend this class, ignore the negativity.
Sai isn\'t the best at explaining things. She expects you to know all the vocabulary before she\'s even taught it to you. Highly disorganized. Nice person.

Found the class slow, unorganized, and a bad learning environment. We learned less than 300 words the entire semester, didn\'t have test or syllabus until 4 weeks before the end of the semester, never had a textbook (and less than 5 handouts), and moved at a snails pace. Sai made fun of slow students and doesn\'t answer emails-- at all. Avoid class.

Sai-ji is a fantastic teacher - creative, spontaneous, down to earth, super helpful and approachable. She has an amazing ability to on the spot create a whole lesson from one small comment or question from a student. The class was often the highlight of my day - a hilarious one that I will never forget.
